Post-Match Reflections: Bailey Ober said that if the Twins had everyone healthy, they would have been in the playoffs.
Byron Buxton and Carlos Correa were both missing when the Twins' downswing began, leaving a clubhouse presence void and a lineup void in their wake.
Brooks Lee, Jose Miranda, Royce Lewis, and Simeon Woods Richardson struggled with the length of the season as they played through career-high workloads.
Lee, Woods Richardson, and Lewis alluded to struggles with the length of the season as they played through career-high workloads.
David Festa bore a much larger than expected workload due to the injuries to key players in key moments.
Chris Paddack and Joe Ryan's injuries contributed to Matthews being rushed to the Majors.
Byron Buxton and Carlos Correa ultimately came back strong for the season's final two weeks, but were missing when the Twins' downswing began.
Correa hit the shelf on July 20 and Buxton followed on Aug. 15 -- and three days later, the Twins' slide began.
Carlos Santana's acquisition worked out better than anyone could have hoped, but the marginal pitching acquisitions were all non-factors.
Brock Stewart got injured before undergoing season-ending arthroscopic shoulder surgery, and Jorge Alcala started a steep regression from a successful first half.
Trevor Richards was designated for assignment on Aug. 27 and didn't last a month on the roster.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins have been held to four or fewer runs in 23 of their past 29 games entering Sunday's regular-season finale.
Their 140 runs scored since Aug. 18 ranks 24th of 30 teams.
Their 29 homers rank 28th, ahead of only the Reds (27) and White Sox (26).
The Twins dropped their Opening Day payroll by more than $26 million following their breakthrough 2023 season.
The front office was severely hampered in adding to the roster in the offseason due to budgetary restrictions.
The Carlos Santana acquisition on a one-year, $5.25 million contract worked out better than anyone could have hoped.
The Twins added only Trevor Richards at the Trade Deadline, and he didn't last a month on the roster.
Jay Jackson, Steven Okert, Josh Staumont, Justin Topa, and Anthony DeSclafani were all non-factors in the pitching staff's issues.
